body_html: In particular, the using-the-same-filename issue is already present: suppose the directory already exists in advance, and you run two jobs training and logging to the same directory. They might write to the same file already as it is now – changing the semantics here does not affect that bug. Since these are two separate bugs they can be fixed in two separate issues and PRs.
body_text: In particular, the using-the-same-filename issue is already present: suppose the directory already exists in advance, and you run two jobs training and logging to the same directory. They might write to the same file already as it is now – changing the semantics here does not affect that bug. Since these are two separate bugs they can be fixed in two separate issues and PRs.
body: In particular, the using-the-same-filename issue is _already_ present: suppose the directory already exists in advance, and you run two jobs training and logging to the same directory. They might write to the same file already as it is now – changing the semantics here does not affect that bug. Since these are two separate bugs they can be fixed in two separate issues and PRs.
